name: hostname
title: hostname manual page
description: The hostname utility prints the name of the current host.

sections.title: NAME
codeBlocks:
hostname – set or print name of current host system
     hostname [-f] [-s | -d] [name-of-host]
     The hostname utility prints the name of the current host.	The super-user
     can set the hostname by supplying an argument.  To keep the hostname
     between reboots, run ‘scutil --set HostName name-of-host’.

     Options:

     -f    Include domain information in the printed name.  This is the
	   default behavior.

     -s    Trim off any domain information from the printed name.

     -d    Only print domain information.
     Set the host name of the machine and check the result:

	   $ hostname beastie.localdomain.org
	   $ hostname
	   beastie.localdomain.org

     Do not show domain information:

	   $ hostname -s
	   beastie

     Show only domain information:

	   $ hostname -d
	   localdomain.org
     gethostname(3), scutil(8)
     The hostname command appeared in 4.2BSD.
